channel.title: Fictional Book Cover
channel.description:
Give me your worst, it's a school project that's due tomorrow.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/mV4I5.jpg[/img]
Not sure why but I don't really like it. I did it last minute. Bottom of the spline says "Titan Publishing" (was required in the instructions; the original file is like 10x15 inches, it's readable there)
Everything is my own except the picture of the boat on the back. Can you even tell it's a boat? :/
Anchor and lighthouse are vector illustrations
Font for the title(s) is a slightly customized version of century gothic
Oh and the clouds on top were part of a brush set.
If you think something could be made better, please tell me :o (seriously)
edit: don't dox me br0

If this was a book, I would buy it gj

item.title: Fictional Book Cover
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

reyx7:

Not liking the box around the text on the back. Maybe if you made the text slightly bolder you could remove the box.

I turned it in earlier, and I changed the box around a bit before I submitted it. I didn’t really like it either, I thought it made the boat hard to see

And thank you

Read full topic

item.title: Fictional Book Cover
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

sanga282:

tbh that’d be fine as a book cover, if i picked that up in the shop i’d think it looked fairly professional so yeah good times

Agreed, I like it.

item.title: Fictional Book Cover
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

If it’s a book cover and it’s the front, spline, and back, does it have to blend with the front and back? All the books I have are solid colours so I wasn’t sure

And what do you mean by choppy? :o

Read full topic

item.title: Fictional Book Cover
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Wouldnt look so bad if the top wasnt so choppy, and if the middle of the book blended with the front and back.

Read full topic
